intro: Tanacetum armenum, commonly known as Armenian tansy, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
